verses.kjv: My brethren, have not the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, with respect of persons.
verses.web: My brothers, don’t hold the faith of our Lord Jesus Christ of glory with partiality.
verses.ct: My brothers, as believers in our Lord Jesus Christ, the Lord of glory, you must never show favoritism.

verses.kjv: For if there come unto your assembly a man with a gold ring, in goodly apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment;
verses.web: For if a man with a gold ring, in fine clothing, comes into your synagogue, and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in,
verses.ct: Suppose someone walks into your meeting wearing a gold ring and expensive clothes, and right behind him comes a poor man dressed in rags.

verses.kjv: And ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto him, Sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, Stand thou there, or sit here under my footstool:
verses.web: and you pay special attention to him who wears the fine clothing and say, “Sit here in a good place;” and you tell the poor man, “Stand there,” or “Sit by my footstool”
verses.ct: If you give special attention to the well-dressed man and say, "Here, take this excellent seat," but tell the poor man, "Stand over there," or "Sit on the floor by my feet" —

verses.kjv: Are ye not then partial in yourselves, and are become judges of evil thoughts?
verses.web: haven’t you shown partiality among yourselves, and become judges with evil thoughts?
verses.ct: haven't you created divisions among yourselves and become judges driven by evil motives?

verses.kjv: Hearken, my beloved brethren, Hath not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith, and heirs of the kingdom which he hath promised to them that love him?
verses.web: Listen, my beloved brothers. Didn’t God choose those who are poor in this world to be rich in faith, and heirs of the Kingdom which he promised to those who love him?
verses.ct: Listen carefully, my dear brothers. Hasn't God chosen those who are poor in this world to be rich in faith and to inherit the kingdom he promised to those who love him?

verses.kjv: But ye have despised the poor. Do not rich men oppress you, and draw you before the judgment seats?
verses.web: But you have dishonored the poor man. Don’t the rich oppress you, and personally drag you before the courts?
verses.ct: But you've dishonored the poor. Think about it — aren't the rich the ones who oppress you and drag you into court?

verses.kjv: Do not they blaspheme that worthy name by the which ye are called?
verses.web: Don’t they blaspheme the honorable name by which you are called?
verses.ct: Aren't they the ones who blaspheme the noble name of the one you belong to?

verses.kjv: If ye fulfil the royal law according to the scripture, Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself, ye do well:
verses.web: However, if you fulfill the royal law according to the Scripture, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” you do well.
verses.ct: Now, if you're truly keeping the royal law found in Scripture — "You shall love your neighbor as yourself" — then you're doing the right thing.

verses.kjv: But if ye have respect to persons, ye commit sin, and are convinced of the law as transgressors.
verses.web: But if you show partiality, you commit sin, being convicted by the law as transgressors.
verses.ct: But if you show favoritism, you commit sin, and the law convicts you as a transgressor.

verses.kjv: For whosoever shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one point, he is guilty of all.
verses.web: For whoever keeps the whole law, and yet stumbles in one point, he has become guilty of all.
verses.ct: Because whoever obeys the entire law but breaks it at just one point is guilty of breaking all of it.

verses.kjv: For he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill. Now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art become a transgressor of the law.
verses.web: For he who said, “Do not commit adultery,” also said, “Do not commit murder.” Now if you do not commit adultery, but murder, you have become a transgressor of the law.
verses.ct: The same God who said, "Do not commit adultery," also said, "Do not murder." So even if you've never committed adultery, if you commit murder, you've still broken the law.

verses.kjv: So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judged by the law of liberty.
verses.web: So speak and so do, as men who are to be judged by a law of freedom.
verses.ct: So let everything you say and do reflect the fact that you will be judged by the law that sets people free.

verses.kjv: For he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shewed no mercy; and mercy rejoiceth against judgment.
verses.web: For judgment is without mercy to him who has shown no mercy. Mercy triumphs over judgment.
verses.ct: Because anyone who refuses to show mercy will face judgment without mercy. But mercy triumphs over judgment.

verses.kjv: What doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith, and have not works? can faith save him?
verses.web: What good is it, my brothers, if a man says he has faith, but has no works? Can faith save him?
verses.ct: My brothers, what good is it if someone claims to have faith but doesn't back it up with action? Can that kind of faith save him?

verses.kjv: If a brother or sister be naked, and destitute of daily food,
verses.web: And if a brother or sister is naked and in lack of daily food,
verses.ct: Suppose a brother or sister has no clothes and nothing to eat today.

verses.kjv: And one of you say unto them, Depart in peace, be ye warmed and filled; notwithstanding ye give them not those things which are needful to the body; what doth it profit?
verses.web: and one of you tells them, “Go in peace. Be warmed and filled;” yet you didn’t give them the things the body needs, what good is it?
verses.ct: If one of you says to them, "Go in peace! Stay warm and eat well," but doesn't give them what they actually need — what good does that do?

verses.kjv: Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.
verses.web: Even so faith, if it has no works, is dead in itself.
verses.ct: In the same way, faith that doesn't produce action is dead — completely lifeless on its own.

verses.kjv: Yea, a man may say, Thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me thy faith without thy works, and I will shew thee my faith by my works.
verses.web: Yes, a man will say, “You have faith, and I have works.” Show me your faith without works, and I will show you my faith by my works.
verses.ct: Someone might argue, "You have faith, and I have works." Fine — show me your faith without any works, and I'll show you my faith by what I do.

verses.kjv: Thou believest that there is one God; thou doest well: the devils also believe, and tremble.
verses.web: You believe that God is one. You do well. The demons also believe, and shudder.
verses.ct: You believe that there is one God? Good for you. But even the demons believe that — and they tremble in terror.

verses.kjv: But wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without works is dead?
verses.web: But do you want to know, vain man, that faith apart from works is dead?
verses.ct: Do you need proof, you foolish person, that faith without works is dead?

verses.kjv: Was not Abraham our father justified by works, when he had offered Isaac his son upon the altar?
verses.web: Wasn’t Abraham our father justified by works, in that he offered up Isaac his son on the altar?
verses.ct: Wasn't our ancestor Abraham shown to be right with God by what he did when he offered his son Isaac on the altar?

verses.kjv: Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?
verses.web: You see that faith worked with his works, and by works faith was perfected.
verses.ct: You can see that his faith and his actions worked hand in hand — his faith was made complete by what he did.

verses.kjv: And the scripture was fulfilled which saith, Abraham believed God, and it was imputed unto him for righteousness: and he was called the Friend of God.
verses.web: So the Scripture was fulfilled which says, “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him as righteousness,” and he was called the friend of God.
verses.ct: This fulfilled the Scripture that says, "Abraham believed God, and it was credited to him as righteousness." He was even called the friend of God.

verses.kjv: Ye see then how that by works a man is justified, and not by faith only.
verses.web: You see then that by works, a man is justified, and not only by faith.
verses.ct: So you can see that a person is made right with God by what they do, not by faith alone.

verses.kjv: Likewise also was not Rahab the harlot justified by works, when she had received the messengers, and had sent them out another way?
verses.web: In the same way, wasn’t Rahab the prostitute also justified by works, in that she received the messengers and sent them out another way?
verses.ct: The same is true of Rahab the prostitute. Wasn't she shown to be right with God by her actions — when she took in the messengers and helped them escape by a different route?

verses.kjv: For as the body without the spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead also.
verses.web: For as the body apart from the spirit is dead, even so faith apart from works is dead.
verses.ct: Just as a body without a spirit is dead, so faith without works is dead.
